name: Influenza 🤒
symptoms: Fever, chills, muscle aches, dry persistent cough, shortness of breath, sore throat

name: Acute Otitis Media (Ear Infection) 👂
ageGroup: Most common between 6 months and 2 years
symptoms: Ear pain, tugging or pulling at an ear, difficulty hearing, loss of balance, fluid drainage from ear
prevention: Hand washing, coughing or sneezing into the elbow

name: Bronchiolitis 🫁
symptoms: Runny nose, cough, difficulty breathing, wheezing
prevention: Hand washing, disinfect surfaces, avoid sharing drinking glasses

name: Respiratory syncytial virus (RSV) 🦠
symptoms: Runny nose, dry cough, low-grade fever, sore throat, wheezing, rapid breathing or difficulty breathing
prevention: Hand washing, disinfecting surfaces, avoid sharing drinking glasses, protective medication available to high risk children

name: Conjunctivitis (Pink Eye) 👁️
ageGroup: Most common in infants and toddlers
symptoms: Redness in one or both eyes, itchiness in one or both eyes, discharge in one or both eyes
prevention: Hand washing, avoid touching eyes, change pillowcases often, avoid sharing personal eye care items

name: Acute sinusitis 👃
ageGroup: Most common in less than 5 years old
symptoms: Thick mucus from the nose, postnasal drainage, tenderness or pressure around sinuses, ear pressure

name: Strep Throat 👅
symptoms: Throat pain, painful swallowing, red and swollen tonsils, swollen tender lymph nodes in the neck
prevention: Hand washing, cover mouth when coughing or sneezing, avoid sharing drinking glasses
